other_tests.findings: Histologically normal parathyroid gland was observed at the time of subtotal thyroidectomy.
200 units of human PTH 1–34 produced a peak cAMP response of 33.2 nmol/100 ml with a control value of 0.9 nmol/100 ml. Indicated normal PTH sensitivity.
Serum cortisol levels of 0.2 and 0.5 μg/dl during ACTH stimulation.
Initial serum calcium was 8.0 mg/dl, subsequently achieving levels of 8.9 mg/dl one month later, and further increased to 9.2 and 9.7 mg/dl at three and thirteen months after discharge, respectively.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Increased from 8.0 mg/dl to 9.7 mg/dl over time.
